head.title: Home - Superior School District

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.h1:
Superior School District
"Everyone working together for a SUPERIOR education!"

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: SUPERIOR STUDENT WINS KEEP MONTANA GREEN POSTER CONTEST
a.span: SUPERIOR STUDENT WINS KEEP MONTANA GREEN POSTER CONTEST

li.a: SUPERIOR STUDENT WINS KEEP MONTANA GREEN POSTER CONTEST

h3.style: font-size: 20px; background-color: rgb(113, 18, 1); border-bottom: 8px solid rgb(62, 10, 1); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: asapbold; margin: 0px; padding: 7px;

p.style: text-align: center;

span.strong: Welcome to the Superior School District web page!

br.span: Please check in frequently for announcements and upcoming events!

strong.style: font-size: 20px; text-align: center; color: rgb(31, 73, 125); letter-spacing: normal;

p.style: letter-spacing: normal; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

li.style: margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

strong.span: Superior School District #3 schools will be closed through Friday, May 8th. This includes all school buildings, gyms, classrooms, and playgrounds. SSD3 Trustees will meet on Monday, May 4th to consider how our schools will proceed through the end of the school year.

li.style: margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

strong.span: Plans are underway to offer a 2020 Graduation ceremony for seniors that complies with the Governor's guidance regarding social distancing. Stay tuned!

li.style: margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

strong.span: The MHSA has officially ended the spring sport season and as a result all extracurricular programs are cancelled for the remainder of the school year.

li.style: margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: inherit; text-align: left;

strong.span: The school lunch program will offer grab and go meals every weekday for students, from 11:00 am to 1:00 pm Monday - Friday @ Superior Elementary.

li.style: margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 6px; font-family: inherit; text-align: left;

strong.span: If you can not make it to school to pick up meals, they can be ordered for delivery by calling Superior Elementary at 406-822-3600 x 200.

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, ".SFNSText-Regular", sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33);

br.span: Junior High & High School Students: Teachers will be providing virtual office hours starting on Monday, April 13th. Here's the link for the schedule and further instructions:

br.br:
If you would like to watch the #principalsviral challenges and you do not have Facebook
Go To > youtube.com and type in principal's viral challenge to watch the videos!

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

span.span: Questions about COVID-19? Please use this checklist to plan and take action if a COVID-19 outbreak occurs in your community.

br.br: Practice and reinforce good prevention habits with your family.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal; text-align: left;

div.p: · Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom; before eating; and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: Keep your child at home if sick with any symptoms or illness.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · If your child is sick, keep them at home and contact your healthcare provider. Talk with teachers about classroom assignments and activities they can do from home to keep up with their schoolwork.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: Be prepared if your child’s school or childcare facility is temporarily dismissed.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Talk with your employer about sick leave and telework options in case you need to stay home with your child. Consider planning for alternate childcare arrangements.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: Create a household plan of action.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Consider members of the household that may be at greater risk such as older adults and people with severe chronic illnesses.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Create a list of local organizations you and your household can contact in case you need access to information, healthcare services, support, and resources.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Create an emergency contact list including family, friends, neighbors, carpool drivers, healthcare providers, teachers, employers, the local public health department, and other community resources.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Choose a room in your house that can be used to separate sick household members from others.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Ask your neighbors what their plan includes.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: In case of an outbreak in your community, protect yourself and others.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Stay home and speak to your healthcare provider if you develop fever, cough, or shortness of breath.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · If you develop emergency warning signs for COVID-19 get medical attention immediately. Emergency warning signs in adults*. This list is not all-inclusive. Please consult your medical provider for any other symptom that is severe or concerning.

ul.li: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath.
Persistent pain or pressure in the chest.
New confusion or inability to arouse.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Keep away from others who are sick.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Limit close contact with others as much as possible (about 6 feet).

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Put your household plan into action.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Continue to practice everyday preventive actions

ul.li: If someone in the household is sick, separate them into the prepared room.
If caring for a household member, follow the recommended precautions and monitor your own health.
If you become sick, stay in contact with others by phone or email.
Stay informed about the local outbreak situation.
Notify your work if your schedule needs to change.
Take care of the emotional health of your household members, including yourself.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: justify; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: If Your School/Childcare Program is Dismissed

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Keep track of school dismissal updates.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: o Read or watch local media sources that report school dismissals or stay in touch with your school.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Talk to your school about options for digital and distance learning.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Discourage children and teens from gathering in other public places while school is dismissed to help slow the spread of COVID-19 in the community.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;
p.strong: Take additional precautions for those at highest risk, particularly older adults and those who have severe underlying health conditions.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Consider staying at home and away from crowds if you or a family member are an older adult or have underlying health issues.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Make sure you have access to several weeks of medications and supplies in case you need to stay home.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · When you go out in public, keep away from others who are sick, and limit close contact with others.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal;

div.p: · Practice good hand hygiene.

p.style: text-align: center;

div.div: read more... About Green Ribbon School
PO Box 400, Superior, MT 59872 | Phone 406-822-3600 | Fax Elementary: 406-822-3601 High School: 406-822-4396

The Superior Public Schools website is designed to provide equal access information to all members of the Superior Community. Contact the Superintendent at srkinney@ssd3.us regarding questions about the functionality of, or content on the website that is inaccessible. Information on filing a formal grievance with the District pursuant to the requirements of Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act 1990 can be found by clicking the “School Board District Policy” link under “School Board” Find Policy 4316 - Cross Reference 1700 – Uniform Complaint Procedure can be found under the School Board Tab by selection “Board Policies.” This information may also be obtained by contacting the Superintendent at srkinney@ssd3.us.
